page.title: 03ETHERLEY & ESCOMB VILLAGES
page.content: The people of both villages stressed the friendly atmosphere and the rural aspects were highly valued. In Etherley concern was expressed about the amount of traffic through the village, the digging upof the Rail Trail and the low flying aircraft from bases in North Yorkshire. The local cricket ground is popular but there is a strong desire for improved bus services and more local shops. In Escomb most residents have lived here for forty to sixty years, but there are young families. More houses have been built over the last forty years but some said that the rebuilding has spoilt the character of the village and its community feeling. High rents and lack of local shops cause concern. The Saxon Church attracts many visitors and Church events are keenly supported.
